etymologies: early 19th century. From Tibetan ma-ṇi sometimes used elliptically to denote the mantra Om mani padme hum, and so applied metonymically to any structure or object containing this mantra

definitions: Any of various sacred objects or aids to prayer; especially a prayer wheel containing ‘ Om maṇi padme hūṃ ’ or other mantras, or a stone slab or wall of slabs inscribed with this or other mantras (frequently attributive in "mani wall").
